security_audit.summary: The skill-creator is a legitimate development tool with minimal security risk. It provides templates and validation for creating AI skills. While it has filesystem access for creating directories and files, this is necessary for its stated purpose. No malicious patterns detected.

low_findings.title: Directory Traversal Potential in Path Handling
low_findings.description: The init_skill.py script accepts user-provided paths without strict validation. While it uses Path.resolve() which helps, a malicious user could potentially create skills in unexpected locations if they have write permissions.

content.user_title: Create Custom AI Skills with Templates
content.value_statement: Building AI skills from scratch is complex and time-consuming. This skill provides templates, validation tools, and best practices to create effective skills that extend Claude's capabilities.
actual_capabilities: Generates skill templates with proper YAML frontmatter
Validates skill structure and metadata requirements
Packages skills into distributable zip files
Provides best practices for skill organization
Includes example scripts and reference documentation
limitations: Only creates local skill directories, no cloud integration
Basic validation - doesn't check skill effectiveness
Templates need manual customization for specific use cases

best_practices: Start with concrete examples of how the skill will be used before writing content
Keep SKILL.md focused on essential instructions, move detailed info to references/
Test skills on real tasks and iterate based on performance issues
anti_patterns: Don't include duplicate information across SKILL.md and reference files
Avoid overly broad skills that try to do too many unrelated things
Don't skip validation - always test skill structure before packaging

faq.question: What programming languages are supported for scripts?
faq.answer: Any executable script works - Python, Bash, JavaScript, etc. Python is recommended for cross-platform compatibility.

faq.question: Is there a size limit for skill files?
faq.answer: No hard limit, but keep SKILL.md under 5k words. Large reference files should include search patterns for efficient access.

faq.question: Can skills integrate with external APIs?
faq.answer: Yes, include API documentation in references/ and example scripts showing authentication and common operations.

faq.question: How do I ensure my skill is safe for others to use?
faq.answer: Follow security best practices: validate inputs, avoid hardcoded credentials, use secure network practices, and test thoroughly.

faq.question: What if my skill isn't working as expected?
faq.answer: Use the validation script to check structure, test with real examples, and iterate based on Claude's feedback during usage.

faq.question: Can I update an existing skill?
faq.answer: Yes, edit the files directly and re-package. Consider versioning major changes and testing updates before distribution.
